definitions: coat of arms or heraldic shield displaying family symbols
public display or proclamation of achievements or qualities
examples: The knight's blazon featured a golden lion on crimson
Family blazons decorated the ancient castle's great hall
The company's blazon of awards covered the entire lobby wall
His resume was a blazon of prestigious accomplishments

definitions: chemical substance used to whiten or remove color from materials
examples: She added bleach to the laundry for brighter whites
The pool requires bleach to maintain proper sanitation levels
Household bleach effectively kills germs on kitchen surfaces
Never mix bleach with ammonia or other cleaning products

definitions: tiered bench seating typically found at sports venues or outdoor events
examples: Fans filled the bleachers for the championship baseball game
The wooden bleachers creaked under the weight of spectators
Students gathered in the gymnasium bleachers for the assembly
We found seats in the bleachers overlooking center field

definitions: loss of blood from damaged blood vessels or wounds
spreading of color or dye beyond intended boundaries
examples: The paramedic quickly stopped the bleeding with direct pressure
Internal bleeding requires immediate medical attention and treatment
The bleeding of colors ruined her favorite white shirt
Newspaper ink bleeding made the text difficult to read

definitions: short high-pitched electronic sound from a device
sound used to censor offensive language in broadcasts
examples: The heart monitor's steady bleep reassured the medical staff
My pager emitted three quick bleeps signaling an emergency
Television networks use bleeps to cover profanity in interviews
The comedy show had so many bleeps it was hard to follow

definitions: mark or flaw on skin affecting appearance
imperfection that mars the appearance or quality of something
examples: The dermatologist treated the blemish with topical medication
Teenage acne left several blemishes on her complexion
A single blemish on his driving record prevented the promotion
The painting's only blemish was a tiny scratch in the corner

definitions: mixture of different substances or elements combined together harmoniously
examples: This coffee blend combines beans from three different countries
The chef created a unique blend of spices for the dish
Their music represents a blend of jazz and classical influences
The fabric was a comfortable blend of cotton and polyester

definitions: electrical kitchen appliance with rotating blades for mixing liquids and soft foods
examples: She used the blender to make fresh fruit smoothies daily
The powerful blender crushed ice cubes in seconds
Pour all ingredients into the blender and pulse until smooth
Their commercial blender handles even the toughest vegetables

definitions: process of combining different elements to create a harmonious mixture
examples: The blending of colors created a beautiful sunset effect
Wine blending requires years of experience and refined taste
Cultural blending enriches communities through diverse perspectives
The blending of genres produced an innovative musical style

definitions: divine or spiritual favor and protection bestowed upon someone
something that brings happiness, benefit, or good fortune
examples: The priest gave his blessing to the newlywed couple
They sought the elder's blessing before beginning their journey
Her new job turned out to be a blessing in disguise
Having supportive parents is truly a blessing in life

definitions: disease that causes plants to wither and die
something that spoils, damages, or destroys an area or situation
examples: Potato blight devastated Irish crops in the nineteenth century
The fungal blight spread rapidly through the orchard trees
Urban blight left many neighborhoods with abandoned buildings
Corruption became a blight on the city's political system

definitions: non-rigid airship filled with gas used for observation or advertising
examples: The advertising blimp circled above the football stadium slowly
Military blimps provided coastal surveillance during wartime operations
Television cameras mounted on blimps capture aerial sports footage
The Goodyear blimp has become an iconic sight at major events

definitions: adjustable window covering for controlling light and privacy
concealed shelter used by hunters to observe wildlife
examples: She adjusted the blind to block the afternoon sunlight
Venetian blinds provided privacy while allowing airflow
Hunters waited patiently in the duck blind near the marsh
The photography blind allowed close observation of nesting birds

definitions: leather or plastic device attached to horse bridles limiting peripheral vision
examples: The racehorse wore blinders to maintain focus during competition
Carriage horses in cities often wear blinders for safety
Removing the blinders allowed the horse to see approaching danger
Traditional blinders help prevent horses from becoming distracted

definitions: piece of cloth tied over eyes to prevent seeing
examples: The children wore blindfolds during the party game
She removed his blindfold to reveal the surprise renovation
The hostage's blindfold was finally removed after three days
Pin the tail on the donkey requires a secure blindfold

definitions: ostentatious jewelry or ornamentation meant to display wealth
examples: The rapper's bling included diamond chains and gold teeth
She wore minimal bling to the formal business meeting
His watch collection was pure bling worth millions of dollars
Fashion trends moved away from excessive bling toward minimalism

definitions: rapid closing and opening movement of the eyelid
very brief moment or instant of time
examples: A sudden blink protected her eyes from the dust
The camera captured his blink at the worst possible moment
Everything changed in the blink of an eye
The computer screen disappeared for just a blink

definitions: repeated on and off flashing of lights or eyes
examples: The blinking of hazard lights warned approaching drivers
Excessive blinking can indicate eye irritation or stress
The router's blinking indicated active internet data transfer
Christmas lights created a festive blinking pattern

definitions: small spot of light on radar or electronic display screen
temporary minor problem or unexpected deviation from normal
examples: The radar operator noticed an unidentified blip approaching fast
Each blip on the sonar represented a school of fish
Last quarter's loss was just a blip in overall profits
The scandal proved to be merely a blip in her career

definitions: bubble on skin filled with fluid caused by friction or burning
raised bubble or swelling on a surface
examples: The new shoes gave her painful blisters on both heels
Sunburn blisters required immediate medical attention
Paint blisters appeared where moisture damaged the wall
Heat caused blisters to form on the car's dashboard

definitions: extremely intense, harsh, or severe in nature or effect
examples: The blistering heat made outdoor work nearly impossible today
Her blistering criticism left the committee members speechless
The runner maintained a blistering pace throughout the marathon
The guitarist delivered a blistering solo performance

definitions: sudden intensive military attack using overwhelming force
intensive campaign or concentrated effort to achieve something quickly
examples: The aerial blitz destroyed most of the city's infrastructure
London endured nightly bombing during the wartime blitz
The marketing blitz preceded the product's national launch
The team's defensive blitz overwhelmed the opposing quarterback

definitions: military tactic using speed and overwhelming force to break through enemy lines quickly
examples: The blitzkrieg strategy revolutionized modern warfare tactics completely
Poland fell quickly to the devastating blitzkrieg assault
Their business blitzkrieg captured market share from established competitors
The chess player's blitzkrieg opening caught opponents off guard

definitions: severe snowstorm with strong winds and intense snowfall reducing visibility
examples: The blizzard stranded thousands of travelers at airports nationwide
Emergency services struggled to respond during the historic blizzard
Weather forecasters predicted the blizzard would last three days
The cattle survived the blizzard by huddling together for warmth

definitions: drop or lump of thick liquid or soft substance without definite shape
examples: A blob of paint dripped onto the clean floor
The microscope revealed mysterious blobs in the water sample
She added a blob of whipped cream to her coffee
The radar showed a large blob of precipitation approaching

definitions: group of countries or parties united for common action or purpose
examples: The voting bloc controlled enough seats to pass legislation
Eastern European nations formed a powerful economic bloc
The trade bloc negotiated better terms for member countries
Several parties formed a coalition bloc against the proposal

definitions: solid piece of hard material with flat surfaces
section of a city bounded by streets on all sides
obstruction that prevents movement or progress
examples: Children stacked wooden blocks to build a tower
The sculptor carved the statue from a marble block
Their apartment was three blocks from the subway station
The entire city block lost power during the storm
Road construction created a block in traffic flow
Writer's block prevented her from finishing the novel

definitions: military operation preventing goods or people from entering or leaving an area
any barrier that prevents access or passage
examples: The naval blockade prevented supplies from reaching the island
Historical blockades often led to surrender through starvation
Protesters formed a human blockade outside the government building
The police blockade stopped all vehicles entering the area

definitions: obstruction that blocks a passage, tube, or opening preventing normal flow
examples: The plumber cleared the blockage in the kitchen drain
Arterial blockage required immediate surgical intervention
Traffic blockage lasted hours after the multi-car accident
The blockage in the fuel line caused engine problems

definitions: highly successful and popular movie, book, or other entertainment product
large aerial bomb capable of destroying entire city blocks
examples: The summer blockbuster earned billions at the box office
Publishers hoped her new novel would become a blockbuster
World War Two blockbusters devastated entire neighborhoods
The military dropped blockbusters on strategic enemy targets

definitions: substance or device that prevents or inhibits a specific action or process
player whose role is to obstruct opponents in sports
examples: The doctor prescribed beta blockers for his heart condition
Sun blocker protected her sensitive skin from UV rays
The offensive blocker created space for the running back
She was the team's best blocker at the volleyball net

definitions: small fort or reinforced building used for defense with ports for weapons
examples: The colonial blockhouse protected settlers from raids
Concrete blockhouses lined the beach as coastal defenses
The blockhouse design included thick walls and narrow windows
Soldiers manned the blockhouse throughout the night watch

definitions: act of obstructing or preventing movement or progress
planned movement and positioning of actors on stage
examples: Defensive blocking prevented the opposing team from scoring
The blocking of emergency exits violated safety regulations
The director spent hours perfecting the scene's blocking
Poor blocking made the stage action difficult to follow

definitions: website featuring regular entries of commentary, descriptions, or other material
examples: She updates her travel blog with photos and stories weekly
The cooking blog attracted thousands of daily readers
His political blog influenced public opinion on key issues
Many businesses maintain blogs to engage with customers

definitions: person who writes and maintains a blog regularly
examples: The food blogger reviewed restaurants throughout the city
Fashion bloggers attended the exclusive runway show
Professional bloggers earn income through advertising and sponsorships
The travel blogger documented adventures across six continents

definitions: informal British term for a man or fellow
examples: The bloke at the pub recommended this local beer
He seems like a decent bloke despite first impressions
That bloke from accounting won the office lottery pool
A friendly bloke helped me find the train station

definitions: pale golden or yellowish hair color
examples: His natural blond hair lightened in the summer sun
The child inherited her mother's platinum blond locks
Nordic countries have higher populations with blond hair
She decided to dye her hair from brunette to blond

definitions: person, especially a woman, with pale golden or yellowish hair
examples: The blonde in the red dress caught everyone's attention
She was a natural blonde with striking blue eyes
The movie featured the classic blonde bombshell character
Both blondes in the family had their grandmother's features

definitions: red liquid circulating through arteries and veins carrying oxygen and nutrients
family relationship or ancestral lineage
examples: The nurse drew blood for the laboratory tests
Blood donation saves thousands of lives every year
Royal blood flowed through the prince's veins
They discovered they were related by blood through DNA testing

definitions: scene of violent killing involving many deaths and extensive bloodshed
examples: The battlefield became a bloodbath with thousands of casualties
Witnesses described the attack as an absolute bloodbath
The corporate takeover turned into a financial bloodbath
Critics called the movie an unnecessary bloodbath of violence

definitions: large dog breed with exceptional scent-tracking ability used in law enforcement
examples: Police bloodhounds tracked the escaped prisoner through the swamp
The bloodhound's nose can follow scent trails days old
Search teams brought bloodhounds to find the missing hiker
Her pet bloodhound had the typical droopy ears and wrinkled face

definitions: historical medical practice of withdrawing blood to cure illness
elimination of people from organization or violent killing
examples: Medieval doctors believed bloodletting cured various ailments
Bloodletting with leeches was common medical practice historically
The corporate bloodletting eliminated half the management team
Political bloodletting followed the failed coup attempt

definitions: direct line of descent from an ancestor especially in animals
examples: The racehorse's bloodline included three Kentucky Derby winners
Dog breeders carefully track bloodlines for genetic health
Ancient bloodlines could trace ancestry back centuries
The royal bloodline faced extinction without an heir

definitions: killing or wounding of people typically on a large scale during conflict
examples: Diplomats worked desperately to prevent further bloodshed
The revolution succeeded with minimal bloodshed
Centuries of bloodshed marked the disputed border region
Both sides agreed to ceasefire to stop the bloodshed

definitions: dark green gemstone with red spots used in jewelry and healing
examples: The ancient bloodstone amulet supposedly had healing powers
March birthstone jewelry often features polished bloodstone
Bloodstone deposits are found in India and Brazil
The jeweler set the bloodstone in a silver ring

definitions: flow of blood through the circulatory system of the body
examples: The medication entered her bloodstream within minutes
Oxygen passes from lungs into the bloodstream
Bacteria in the bloodstream can cause serious infection
The poison spread quickly through his bloodstream

definitions: flower or mass of flowers on a plant
state of greatest beauty, freshness, or vigor
examples: Spring blooms covered the cherry trees in pink
The rose bloom lasted only a few days
The actress was in the bloom of her career
Youth's bloom faded with years of hard living

definitions: process of producing flowers or coming into flower
examples: The blooming of desert cacti attracts many tourists
Early blooming indicates an unusually warm spring
Her blooming into womanhood brought new responsibilities
The blooming of their friendship surprised everyone

definitions: flower or cluster of flowers especially on fruit trees
examples: Apple blossoms filled the orchard with sweet fragrance
The cherry blossom festival celebrates spring's arrival
One late frost destroyed all the peach blossoms
Bees busily collected pollen from orange blossoms

definitions: process of producing blossoms or developing in a promising way
examples: The blossoming of fruit trees signals spring's arrival
Early blossoming risks damage from late frosts
Their blossoming romance became obvious to everyone
The blossoming of her artistic talent amazed teachers
